Reading books on devices are fine. I was having issues with "Amazon Kindle has Stopped" trying to Play the Narration on the Mobile (happens everytime I insall on new devces). Solution: copy/move the .axx file via android/data/com.amazon.kindle/files/audible/filename.aax to Download folder, then uninstall Kindle, then reinstall Kindle apk, sync and redownload book, then restart download of Audible Narrration until it locks in 1% of the download, then stop the download and close App, then go to Downloads folder and move back the .aax file to android/data/com.amazon.kindle/files/audible folder that would have at this time recreated itself (does not create via install), reopen Kindle and open book again, start download of Narration and wait until your Notification bar shows the book with play and or play comes up bottom-right in the book, then close Kindle and reopen. Done. Narration should view normal/complete and it will work the way it was intended. Review by Stryker's Lounge | +BJHutton

A reasonably good reader, in general. The one major flaw is not being able to move books to SD card, or set SD card as default storage location. Being able to select a download path for each download, or even setting one manually for everything (eg 128Gb SD card) would make this app dramatically better.  Still, it is how I get all of my digital manga. The problem being I can't keep a ton and have to delete stuff to download more. Very frustrating; If I have a large SD card, I'd like to be able to keep more of my library on it, instead of them filling up my internal storage and making my tablet and many of its other apps go nuts over space issues.

So I really love the app, but I have a few suggestions. The default white background on digital readers is really hard on my eyes, and I imagine that others have the same problem, but I noticed it's kind of difficult to find where to change the background color. I found it, but it did take me a couple of days, so I suggest putting it in the main settings menu instead of the font menu inside the book. Also, I adore widgets as opposed to icons, so if you could possibly add a widget option in the next update that would be fantastic. Another thing that would be lovely is reading reminders. So many of us lead such busy lives that it's easy to forget that we have a book waiting for us. So some sort of daily notification to read our books would be great!

Update as of 6/2 No longer crashes my tablet everytime, which is a step in the right direction, and load time is now only thirty seconds on average so its better, but now my books crash two or three times everytime I open them before finally stabilizing. Not a deal breaker, but still bloody annoying, especially given how smoothly the original version worked. Colour me frustrated but grudgingly tolerant... Was excellent, smoothly functional, elegantly designed, and a delight to use - before the update. Now the app crashes almost everytime I open it and even crashes my tablet about half the time, the carousel only shows a few books and the search function is clunky as hell, the load time is slow and jerky, the control panel is overly complicated and doesn't function as well as the original, and generally the entire app has been rendered useless by the "updates". I don't mind the aesthetic changes I suppose, though I don't see the need since the original was fine while unannounced and unrequested overhauls of this type of service feels heavy handed and inconsiderate. I'm all for innovation, but please have the courtesy to ask if its a paid service, and for the love of heaven KISS - that's Keep It Simple, Stupid. The technical difficulties are unacceptable and ridiculous - I paid for my books, a fair amount in fact, and part of the agreement my being able to read them. Amazon, please refund my money so I can buy hard copies or get the app into a working state. Dissapointed, with both the new app and Amazon's thoughtlessness toward their clients...

Whatever you do, never enable 1-click purchase. I had this app on my phone for a while and read on it all the time. Then I made the mistake of turning on 1-click, and now I am the "proud" owner of over $50 in books I don't want, didn't order, and can't return. The app lags constantly in menus and if you ever tap remotly near where a "buy now with 1-click" button is located, it will buy the book, even if the button is on a previous page and hasn't registered that you left it, or is on the next page and it hasn't changed the screen yet. It also doesn't always tell you that it paid for the book, and the return instructions are years out of date and no longer apply, not to mention if it's a book you rented via unlimited and it makes you "accidentally" buy it it registers you as having completed the book and returning is not an option. Long story short NEVER ENABLE 1-CLICK.

Good for reading ebooks; although, the app downloads and stores images on the device (occupying space) for their sample comics, etc. Sure, such things are potentially helpful for new users, but once they're no longer needed, the user cannot permanently delete them without the app downloading them again. Again, this is helpful if you've purchased an ebook, but it needlessly occupies space in RAM if you aren't downloading new purchases.

Finally evolving towards a workable way to manage digital content! With over 900 books in my library, I was delighted to see that when adding books to a category, the list of possibilities no longer includes books already IN that category! I would really appreciate being able to change the sort order of the possibilities between title/author/recent like you can the library itself, though. I also really wish it was possible to filter the library by multiple categories simultaneously (books categorized as "nonfiction," "reference," and "dogs," for example). It would also be hugely useful to be able to *exclude* books by category (all books categorized as "fiction" but not categorized as "romance," for example).

Updated for newest:  Well... bad to worse.  It can find Amazon to let me buy books.  No problem.  It just can't find the internet to download the same books.  Yet I can turn around and buy another book while it still can't find the net or download...   Interesting when it does download, it says it is downloading but doesn't download. Click download again and it downloads the book.  That's when it can find the Internet to actually download.  Super cluttered. It's more store than reading app.  Not very convenient for keeping track of the book you are reading.  The phrase I would use is an "Ungodly mess."   Congradulations, Amazon. Best reading experience compared to other apps I've tried. More font and text options than others. Word definition, translation, and Wikipedia result are great help when reading. Unfortunately it lacks some feature I need and library management sucks. No default "To Read", "Reading", and "Read" shelves to keep library organized. No ability to delete books in app, has to be done from website. No quick way to add a book you find in the store to a default wishlist. No quick way to see book description from your library. No way to print out book notes and highlight or have them available in office document like Google Play Books does. And a big one, no epub support. Also collections don't sync with desktop app.

There is glitches in the app. I subscribe to free e book emails. When I click on a free book it redirects me to the Kindle store, the book is listed as free. I click "buy now for free" and it borrows the book with my Kindle unlimited. I click "buy for free" again. It says this book is already borrowed and in your library. I return the book and try again. It borrows the book again. The deceptive part is when you click buy for free it gives you the same message as if you bought it. But it only borrowed it. So by the time you realize it's borrowed and not bought the book is no longer free. I've lost at least 30 free ebooks to this glitch. Tonight I had to click "buy for free" and return the book so many times it took 30 minutes to actually buy 4 free books. Please fix this glitch (or is it purposeful to keep us from getting free books) it just seems a little suspicious that the borrow screen and the purchased screen are identical. You have no idea it was borrowed and not purchased. So you eventually lose the free book. Sorry for the rant, love Kindle but very frustrated with this. (Running on oct 22nd update, no newer versions)

I'm  using this app on my Likebook Mars, which uses e-ink. It handles the essentials, but it is not as good as a dedicated Kindle, and it lacks the customization options of a really good Android ereading app like Moon+Reader. It offers a selection of fonts, though the only one I find really suitable is Bookerly. My Kindle Touch and Moon+Reader both allow the use of sideloaded fonts. On my Kindle, I can go to a location with precision by typing in the exact page location I want to go to. With this app, I have to use a slider that moves me through a book in a jumpy, imprecise manner, then page to the location I want to go to after getting somewhere in its neighborhood. For some reason, selecting text is more difficult in this app than it is on my Kindle Touch. While some footnotes appear on the page, some do not. My Kindle has a helpful back arrow for going back to where I was, but the app doesn't. I can report content errors in my Kindle Touch but not in the app. Moon+Reader provides much smoother page turns than this app does. I don't want animated page turns on e-ink.

Overall it is not a bad app for reading ebooks, my main issue is that the page count is always off. For instance, I recently read a novella that was only 117pages (which I counted), but Kindle said it was in the 500-page range. On top of that it skipped page numbers. So it would say that I am on page 122 but then the very next page would be 129. I don't know why it did that but it made it very irritating to have to count my own pages so I know how far actually was in the book. Lucky for me I was reading a novella and not a full-length novel. I will definitely not be reading a full-length novel in Kindle.

Used kindle for samsung for several years up until Samsung stopped the free monthly book service and updated the app accordingly. Ever since it had entirely ceased to work or sync and I lost all of my books even ones I had paid for across all devices (S8+ iPad 4 and a high end gaming pc win7 professional) . I deleted it and installed the original kindle app, this one here. It had resynced all of my data and worked for maybe a week. It has updated again and I have lost all of my books again across all devices. Even paid for books, the store wont load even on my high speed 5ghz wifi connection or full service 4gLTE cell service, so I cant even get back at LEAST the handful of unlimited books I have currently. Until Amazon can stop fixing what isn't broke and making everything worse I will be looking for another ebook app. I'm considering dropping all ties with Amazon totally. Every update reduces functionality and speed, becomes more complicated and clunky, and adds frustration across the board. Barnes and Noble + Netflix is looking to be the best option again for me. The convenience Amazon offers just doesn't seem worth it anymore.

Problem: hyphenation at the end of a page. When a word is split by a hyphen at the end of a line, there's no problem; the word continues on the next line. However, when a word is split by a hyphen at the end of a page, the rest of that word and the line of text following that word fail to appear on the next page. The next page text begins with the next line, leaving one line of text invisible to the reader.

This is my reader of choice, and it gets steadily better, but lacks in in-depth customization options. Actually four stars but temporarily 1 store for the following reason:  I'd like to report a rare bug which only affects a few users such as myself. I cannot find any link online (Via Google etc.) for a bug report system.  Bug: If you use multiple accounts, the in-app store for the Kindle Reader always points to the regional store associated with your single sign-on Amazon account, *not* the account you have registered your kindle reader with. This only effects the in-app store, but not the store your library actually is taken from. This means that if your single sign on is an account in a regional store that is different from the one you have your Kindle library on, you cannot make in-app purchases on your phone or device, but if you buy another book for the registered account via PC browser, it will still be synced to your phone. It is an inconvenience, but not a show stopper if you use Amazon on both Android device and PC.

For all those with Lenovo Tab4 that have the issue with Kindle disabling itself and app icon disappearing, I have found a fix that seems to work so far: Assuming you have updated to Orio (Android 8.1), which is when this started happening to me, if (once you have re-enabled the app in Play Store) you press and hold the Kindle icon - select "app info", then select "Advanced" then allow "Modify system settings ". Now Kindle should stay installed and enabled, did for me anyway. Hope this helps. Matt
